titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3081) to increase the Federal minimum wage and to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide tax benefits for small businesses, and for other purposes, and for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3846) to amend the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 to increase the minimum wage, and for other purposes.

action.text: Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 3081 and H.R. 3846. H.R. 3081 shall be considered in the House and shall be considered as read. In lieu of the amendment recommended by the Committee on Ways and Means now printed in the bill, the text of H.R. 3832 shall be considered as adopted. Debate shall continue for not to exceed two hours, equally divided and controlled, and there shall be one motion to recommit, with or without instructions. H.R. 3846 shall be considered in the House, shall be considered as read, and shall be debatable for one hour, equally divided and controlled. Specified amendments are in order and consist of those printed in the report of the Committee on Rules accompanying this resolution. There shall be one motion to recommit, with or without instructions. Finally, in the engrossment of H.R. 3081, the text of H.R. 3846 as passed by the House shall be added as new matter at the end of H.R.3081, after whi...
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 106-516, by Mr. Sessions.

bill.summary: 3/8/2000--Introduced. Sets forth the rule (closed) for the consideration of H.R. 3081 (minimum wage increase and tax benefits for small businesses).Sets forth the rule (modified closed) for the consideration of H.R. 3846 (minimum wage increase).Directs the Clerk of the House, in the engrossment of H.R. 3081, to await disposition of H.R. 3846, add its text at the end of H.R. 3081, and make appropriate conforming changes.
